resources: false--> SnapTools is a project aimed to provide Snapchat modifications using the Xposed Framework. We provide new functionality and features to the popular Snapchat application, in a seamless and modular way. We use a cloud based download system to allow for straightforward updates as well as support for hotswapping of supported Snapchat versions without the need of a system reboot. Andre (Dev) | Ethan (Dev) | Pedro (Team) | Gabe (Team) NightMean (Team) PLACEHOLDER Disable Enable By pressing YES, you agree to our Terms of Service and our Privacy Policy, both of which can be viewed under the Legal page in the SnapTools app. This application requires External Storage Read/Write access. Any violation of these Terms will result in an immediate and permanent termination of your access to the services. 3. You agree to not in any way redistribute, modify, decompile, reverse engineer, or as a result of any of those activities, share the work you have done without the explicit consent of Andre Marques. Additionally, you may not intentionally obstruct the normal operations of the services in any way, shape, or form. 4. Finally, you agree to all data collection outlined in the Privacy Policy, as well as our use of this data. Privacy Policy By using SnapTools, you agree to have our app collect the following information: - Email address - Username - App version - Device ID - Device model - Device Android version - Device configuration information - Error logs associated with crashes from SnapTools or Snapchat (This can be disabled in Settings, but it is recommended to be enabled) SnapTools guarantees this information will not be used beyond the stated intent of providing a better in-app experience for all users. SnapTools was initially started in early 2017 as a way to provide Snapchat modifications, such as saving, with a new cloud based way of delivering fast updates. What we had in mind was a fully modular system that would allow all our code that interfaces with Snapchat to be downloaded in the form of "packs" from our server and stored and executed within SnapTools itself, allowing for multiple Snapchat versions to be supported, and for code updates to not require a new APK or a device restart. As our knowledge of the inner workings of Snapchat grew, so did our project. We had established an incredibly capable framework and started adding features that many users requested, such as lens collection and management, screenshot bypass, and sharing from gallery, along with many others. We made our Slack page open to the public in August as we prepared for a pre-release, to attract attention and bring users to our community that could help with testing our product before our official release. SnapTools started with Andre (andrerm124) as the sole developer, with Pedro (pedroc1999) and Gabe (quorn23) as part of the decision making team. Ethan (electronicwizard) also joined as a developer/tester and Michal (nightmean) helped while testing SnapTools and during the bug finding process. The majority of our team are currently in or recently graduated from higher level education. Why did you read all this. Android N Warning Although Android N will be supported via the Unofficial Xposed Framework, there may be situations where Xposed is unstable and a hang or crash could happen, this is not the fault of SnapTools and is due to the nature of the unstable Xposed Framework Thank you for considering to donate. Any donations you provide mean the world to our team and hopefully it suggests you're enjoying what we're providing! You've hit the registered device cap, please log out of one or more devices For the fastest response to your questions, please join our Discord server where there is usually 24/7 support. Once joined check out the FAQ channel to check if your question has already been answered. Otherwise try out the @Support tag to notify the support team of your question. Want more information about SnapTools? View our official Website hosted by the lovely ElectronicWizard to get an idea of what we have to offer as well as some FAQ's We also have a Sub-Reddit that is under construction but is still completely usable if you want to post anything relating to SnapTools. Subscribing to us can help to build our community to let new users know that we're a trusted application. The Reddit will contain announcements and an up to date FAQ list. Our XDA page hasn't been created yet. We're currently waiting for a full public release before we create the page. Test1 Test2 Test3 Test4 Test5 GBP USD EUR Default AMOLED Black Release Beta
